title: Can anyone help?

embed.description: Discover what kind of #LoL player you are and learn about your strengths and weaknesses. We give you all the stats you need. Compare yourself with other players.

body: So i want to climb, and i got to s2 this season then tilted back down to s5 twice, but idk how i can climb back up. i seem to do alright in the first 10-15 minutes, then jsut tilt when my entire team has more deaths combined than the team kills. how do i climb as a support?

replies.body:
I like to play thresh often, and honestly I find that the best way to work around that, is really to follow your carry's around in team fights generally the adc.

Say for example, you did ok in the first 15 minutes of the game, and your carry was 4/0 or 3/0 or something like that. How much damage would he do. Say a 5/0 jayce tried to jump on them, and you were playing thresh. flay them back. Alistair. Headbutt, blitz. knock up. braum. ult/e or stun. morg dark binding etc. If your adc knows what they are doing, that should be enough time to shred them. 
In the end, Imo it all falls down to keeping the other team off the adc. sometimes it isn't possible. but when it is, and if you've done your early game well you should be able to keep on top of most teamfights. 

If your adc is good at back lining and you think they will be fine without your baby sitting. just capitalise when the other teams out of position, especially their mid/jg/adc  or any high damage out putters. if you can stun/hook/root one of them, that would turn the team fight dramatically in your favour

Then again, if your mid/top/jg and maybe even your adc is a bunch of boosted bonobo's there isn't much you can do.



Overall I hoped this helped.
Good luck with your climbing

Thanks man, the advice is sound, a lot of the time my adc's have gap closers that they use to jump into fights for some ungodly reason, and zed and yas are prolific at the moment, so sometimes its hard to peel efficiently, but thanks for the advice ive been trying my best not to die heaps and now im trying my best not to let my adcs die. life is hard as a support main.
